I think the OP was asking about how he can easily create regression 
tests.  I personally use a kluge where my test class reads a system 
property and if true it writes to the file, and if false it uses the 
contents of the file as a base for comparison.  Then I run:

  java -Dmyprop=true org.junit.runner.JUnitCore classname

During normal runs the property is not set so the test class asserts 
that the output of the processing is the same as what's in the file.
